intro: Frangula paruensis, commonly known as the African buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes other plants like citrus and buckthorn species. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a small, smooth, orange-red drupe that contains a single seed. Frangula paruensis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
